item.title: Semiprime-ideal variants of theorems of Vukman
item.description: arXiv:2502.17965v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: Let $R$ be an associative ring with a nonzero ideal $I$ and a semiprime ideal $T$ such that $T\subsetneq I.$ Let $K$ be a nonempty subset of $R$ and $d:R\to R$ be a derivation of $R$, if $[d(x),x]\in T$ for all $x\in K,$ then $d$ is said to be a $T$-commuting derivation on $K.$ The main purpose of this paper is to show that if char$(R/T)\neq 2$ and any of ~$[[d(x),x],x]\in T,$~ $[d(x),x]d(x)\in T,$~ $d(x)[d(x),x]\in T$ holds on $I,$ then $d$ is $T$-commuting on $I$. Consequently, we extend some known results of Vukman \cite{Vukman1990}.
item.dc:creator: Gurninder Singh Sandhu

item.title: On the Jucys-Murphy method and fusion procedure for the Sergeev superalgebra
item.description: arXiv:2502.18096v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We use the Jucys-Murphy elements to construct a complete set of primitive idempotents for the Sergeev superalgebra. We apply them to give a version of the seminormal form for the irreducible modules with an explicit construction of basis vectors. We show that the idempotents can also be obtained from a new version of the fusion procedure.
item.dc:creator: Iryna Kashuba, Alexander Molev, Vera Serganova
